item.title: Cron Jobs in AWS 1: EB Workers
item.description: Cron jobs are inevitable parts of any infrastructure; they are things that you want to run on certain periods, things you want to offload to calm hours, things that glue your services to each other, keep costs down and your sanity intact. Even though the term “cron job” may seem to describe a pretty specific set of characteristics; mainly being repetitive and scheduled, it is still a pretty generic term. Before designing and deploying a cron job, you should think about characteristics that differentiate jobs from each other.
